alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 1:03AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pondera, northern Teton and west central Chouteau Counties through 130 AM MDT... At 102 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 22 miles northwest of Choteau to 9 miles northeast of Dutton. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conrad, Dutton, Brady, The Knees, Collins, Bynum, Pendroy and Farmington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 313 and 338. Highway 89 between mile markers 48 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also lead to minor localized flooding, especially in low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
